title: DynamicTemperature_TFCR

temperature_beginning.title: temperature_beginning
temperature_beginning.description: The initial temperature, prior to the start of the reaction, should be specified.

temperature_after_event.title: temperature_after_event
temperature_after_event.description: The temperature that is present after a specific event has occurred.

event_description.title: event_description
event_description.description: Information regarding the event that caused the temperature change. In the case of a fed-batch reaction protocol, this event can also be the planned adjustment of the temperature to another specific        value based on the current progress of the reaction process.

temperature_at_XY.title: temperature_at_XY
temperature_at_XY.description: The temperature can also be measured at a variably chosen time point

time_at_XY.title: time_at_XY
time_at_XY.description: Specification of the exact time point

time_unit.title: time_unit
time_unit.description: Common units for specifying time can be s (seconds), min (minutes) h (hours).

temperature_unit.title: temperature_unit
temperature_unit.description: The temperature can be specified in units such as K, °C, or °F.

temperature_gradient_beginning.title: temperature_gradient_beginning
temperature_gradient_beginning.description: The initial temperature from which the temperature gradient begins. (

temperature_gradient_end.title: temperature_gradient_end
temperature_gradient_end.description: The target temperature reached after the temperature gradient is applied. (

gradient_length.title: gradient_length
gradient_length.description: The distance or time span over which the temperature gradient is applied. (

gradient_length_unit.title: gradient_length_unit
gradient_length_unit.description: The gradient length can be specified either as the physical distance (e.g. in meters) or as the time span (e.g. in minutes). (

measurement_points.title: measurement_points
measurement_points.description: Information about the locations or time points where temperature measurements are taken to monitor the gradient. This can be important to ensure that the gradient behaves as intended.                       (

special_treatment.title: special_treatment
special_treatment.description: If there are any other specific methods, procedures, characteristics or aspects related to the temperature profile that are important for reproducibility and are not described by the aforementioned         metadata, they should be explained here.

description: If there is a temperature gradient or different temperatures are measured in the system, these must be described as well as possible.
